@m3equals333 LOL "financial suicide" $MSFT had 80b in operative cash flow over the last twelve months. they can buy $TWTR for 50b all cash and in, i estimate, 7 months, their cash position is exactly the same as today (and they own twitter). it is really not a big deal for microsoft.  
  
also, they are not a private entity as musk is, so they need not even make their offer all cash.
$BABA 25B buyback is even bigger than $MSFT buyback.
@schobes $MSFT has a net cash position of ~$70bn.  A $45-50bn hit would be a BIG deal.  For a $$ eating company like $TWTR, it would be financial suicide.

@m3equals333 how would it be "detrimental" for, say, $MSFT, if they spend like 3% of their market cap to acquire a company with a global brand at a p/s lower than msft p/s? $TWTR would be a minor bet for microsoft - and not even a bad one imo

$TWTR doubt it will happen, but If any megacap (e.g. $goog, $msft, $amzn) makes a bid for twtr, I will dump ALL my positions in that company immediately.  I suspect I won't be the only one.  Would be detrimental for their stock...
